item.title: Dangerously loose paving stones outside F.Hinds lower High Street, 5th November
item.description:
A pedestrian fell after slipping on loose paving stones with a precipitous incline, probably about two inches of moving vertical space. Please could the loose stones be set safely back in place? Thanks, Tabi

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 229 High Street, Cheltenham

item.title: No lighting at all at the roundabout and crossing., 4th November
item.description:
There is currently no lighting on the roundabout or the dangerous crossing just off of the roundabout. I have nearly witnessed 3 road traffic accidents due to it being so dark up there. Colleagues of mine have also expressed how hard it is to judge the oncoming traffic and car signals due to the darkness around the area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A417, Birdlip
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Totally unnecessary traffic lights, 5th November
item.description:
Why does Greenways have traffic lights? This just adds to more drivers stopping and more time wasted and more pollution. The few drivers who use this can surely wait a few extra seconds? Public finances are limited enough yet here we have a significant sum of money spent on turnings, markings and traffic lights for a single road with only a few houses. There are no traffic lights along this road for Barnwood Avenue, Chosen Way, Larkhay Road, Brookfield Road, Porchester Road. As a taxpayer Iâ€™d like to know how this expenditure and resource putting this in is justified.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Barnwood Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 43 Tewkesbury Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Dog poo bin full, 4th November

item.title: Discarded Road Signs, 4th November
item.description:
After the poorly managed cycle and foot path project along the A40 between the Arle Court Roundabout and the junction of Gloucester Road and Lansdown Road in Cheltenham, a number of road signs and sandbags have been left to rot and corrode in the verges. These need to be removed. Someone from Highways should walk this route on both sides and note the position of these signs, then arrange to have them removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 39 Miserden Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of Litter Bins, 4th November
item.description:
Between Hatherley Post Office and the junction of Hatherley Road and Warden Hill Road, there are no litter bins on the Lansdown Road for a distance of approx. 0.8 miles. At this junction there are two bins within 50 yards of each other I walk this road frequently and pick up litter along the way and I have to carry it for this entire distance before being able to dispose of it. I've reported this a number of times and receive inadequate or no replies.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 130 Hatherley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of Litter Bins, 4th November
item.description:
Between the junction of Gloucester Road and Lansdown Road and Montpellier on the North side, there are no litter bins on the Lansdown Road for a distance of approx. 0.9 miles. I walk this road frequently and pick up litter along the way and I have to carry it for this entire distance before being able to dispose of it. I've reported this a number of times and receive inadequate or no replies.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 5 Lansdown Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
